Sentencas: Stainless steel type 441 (UNS S44100) is being considered for application as a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell (SOFC) interconnect material.
Titulo: The impact of alloy chemistry on the formation of a silicon-rich subscale on two classes of ferritic steels

Sentencas: It had been thought that Laves phase that forms in this alloy preferentially consumes the Si present in the alloy microstructure, thereby avoiding formation of a Si-rich layer at the scale/metal interface.
Titulo: The impact of alloy chemistry on the formation of a silicon-rich subscale on two classes of ferritic steels

Sentencas: Recent work has shown this is not the case and a Si-rich layer does indeed form at the scale/metal interface.
Titulo: The impact of alloy chemistry on the formation of a silicon-rich subscale on two classes of ferritic steels

Sentencas: However, this layer is significantly different from the layer that forms in other ferritic stainless steels, for example, type 430.
Titulo: The impact of alloy chemistry on the formation of a silicon-rich subscale on two classes of ferritic steels

Sentencas: In this present work the Si-rich layer that forms on 441ss is examined and compared to the layer that forms on several 430-type alloys with varying low levels of Si.
Titulo: The impact of alloy chemistry on the formation of a silicon-rich subscale on two classes of ferritic steels

Sentencas: This research has shown that even at very low levels of Si (170 ppm), a Si-rich layer begins to form on the 430-type stainless steels.
Titulo: The impact of alloy chemistry on the formation of a silicon-rich subscale on two classes of ferritic steels

Sentencas: However, the morphology, particularly with respect to the thickness and continuity of the Si-rich subscale that forms in alloy 441ss, is modified in comparison to non-Laves forming ferritic stainless steels and therefore, may not be as detrimental to long term SOFC performance.
Titulo: The impact of alloy chemistry on the formation of a silicon-rich subscale on two classes of ferritic steels
The impact of alloy chemistry on the formation of a silicon-rich subscale on two classes of ferritic steels
